subject: Productivity
title: The Zeigarnik Effect
description: A quick, practical guide to The Zeigarnik Effect.

hook.text: A waitress in 1920s Vienna remembered uncompleted orders perfectly but forgot them the moment they were served.

buildup.text: Psychologist Bluma Zeigarnik tested this. Unfinished tasks stayed in memory; completed ones faded.

discovery.text: The Zeigarnik Effect shows that open goals create mental tension. Your brain keeps working on them.

twist.text: That nagging feeling about unfinished tasks isn't a bug. It's your brain's way of keeping goals alive.

climax.text: Setting a goal opens a mental loop. Your subconscious works on it even while you do other things.

punchline.text: Unfinished goals haunt you. That's a feature, not a bug.

quiz.question: What is the Zeigarnik Effect?
options: Unfinished tasks stay in memory longer than completed ones
